Description: A trip to Lake Lansing for swimming.
Instructions: Ensure campers bring their swimsuit and towel, apply sunscreen, and board the bus at 12:45 PM.

Description: Swimming at the OHS Pool.
Instructions: Ensure campers bring their swimsuit and towel, apply sunscreen, and board the bus at 1:00 PM.

Description: A session for playing various board games.
Instructions: Set up different board games at 10:00 AM and let campers choose and play.

Description: A trip to the Detroit Institute of Art.
Supplies: Field trip shirt, Packed lunch, ID, Water bottle
Instructions: Ensure campers wear their field trip shirt, bring a packed lunch, water bottle, and board the bus at 9:45 AM.

Description: Create your own sidewalk chalk.
Supplies: Plaster of Paris, Water, Food coloring, Silicone molds, Mixing bowl, Spoon
Instructions: Mix plaster of Paris with water and food coloring, pour into molds, let it set, and then remove the chalk from molds.

Description: Play a round of disc golf.
Instructions: Set up a disc golf course and explain the rules to the campers, then let them play.

Description: Play a game of croquet.
Instructions: Set up the croquet course, explain the rules, and let the campers play.

Description: Play a game of ultimate frisbee.
Supplies: Frisbee, Cones for marking the field
Instructions: Set up the field with cones, explain the rules, and let the campers play.

Description: A 3-kilometer walk.
Instructions: Organize the campers and lead them on a 3-kilometer walk.

Description: Make your own salsa.
Supplies: Tomatoes, Onions, Cilantro, Lime, Salt, Peppers, Knife, Cutting board, Bowl
Instructions: Chop all ingredients, mix them in a bowl, and season with salt and lime juice.

Description: An outdoor activity where campers search for hidden containers using GPS.
Supplies: GPS device or smartphone, Notebook, Pen, Small items for trade
Instructions: Provide the coordinates, explain the rules of geocaching, and let the campers search for the hidden containers.

Description: Set up an escape room.
Instructions: Design and set up various puzzles and clues around the room and explain the rules to the campers.

Description: Participate in an escape room challenge.
Instructions: Divide campers into teams, explain the rules, and let them solve the puzzles to escape the room.

Description: A trip to the East Lansing Aquatic Center.
Supplies: Swimsuit, Towel, Water shoes, Sunscreen, Sack lunch
Instructions: Ensure campers bring their swimsuit, towel, water shoes, and sunscreen, and board the bus at 10:30 AM.

Description: Play various camping-themed games.
Instructions: Organize and explain different camping games, and let the campers participate.

Description: A trip to Patriarche Park in East Lansing.
Supplies: Field trip shirt, Packed lunch, ID, Water bottle
Instructions: Ensure campers wear their field trip shirt, bring a packed lunch, water bottle, and board the bus at 12:30 PM.

Description: A tasting event with foods from different cultures.
Supplies: Various foods from different cultures, Ingredient lists
Instructions: Set up the foods in the commons area, provide ingredient lists for each dish, and let campers taste the different foods.

Description: Create rollercoasters using drinking straws.
Supplies: Drinking straws, Tape, Scissors, Cardboard base
Instructions: Use straws and tape to construct rollercoasters on a cardboard base.

Description: Make African thumb pianos.
Supplies: Wood, Metal tines, Nails, Hammer, Paint
Instructions: Assemble the thumb pianos by attaching metal tines to the wooden base, decorate with paint.

Description: Create projectors that display constellations.
Supplies: Paper towel rolls, Black construction paper, Pins, Tape, Flashlight
Instructions: Poke constellation patterns into the black paper, tape it over one end of the paper towel roll, and shine a flashlight through the other end to project the constellations.

Description: Make fruit smoothies.
Supplies: Fresh fruits, Blender, Yogurt, Ice, Cups
Instructions: Blend the fruits with yogurt and ice, then pour into cups and serve.

Description: Create flower patterns using looms.
Instructions: Wrap the yarn around the loom to create flower patterns, then cut and tie off the ends.

Description: Participate in cooperative and group games.
Instructions: Organize the campers into groups and explain the rules of different cooperative games, then let them play.

Description: Make bird feeders using pine cones.
Supplies: Pine cones, Peanut butter, Bird seed, String
Instructions: Spread peanut butter on the pine cones, roll them in bird seed, tie a string to the top, and hang them outside.

Description: Create miniature fairy gardens.
Supplies: Small plants, Soil, Containers, Miniature decorations
Instructions: Fill the container with soil, plant the small plants, and decorate with miniature items to create a fairy garden.

Description: A trip to Hawk Island for swimming and playground activities.
Instructions: Ensure campers bring their swimsuit and towel, apply sunscreen, and board the bus at 12:15 PM.

Description: Build catapults to launch marshmallows.
Supplies: Popsicle sticks, Rubber bands, Plastic spoons, Marshmallows
Instructions: Construct catapults using popsicle sticks and rubber bands, attach a plastic spoon, and use it to launch marshmallows.

Description: Create your own magic wands.
Supplies: Wooden dowels, Paint, Glitter, Glue, Ribbons
Instructions: Decorate wooden dowels with paint, glitter, and ribbons to create magic wands.

Description: Make fruit pizzas.
Supplies: Sugar cookie dough, Cream cheese, Fresh fruits, Baking sheet
Instructions: Bake the cookie dough into a large cookie, spread cream cheese on top, and decorate with fresh fruits.

Description: Create animals using pine cones.
Supplies: Pine cones, Paint, Glue, Googly eyes, Felt
Instructions: Paint and decorate pine cones with googly eyes and felt to create animal figures.

Description: Make animals using toilet paper rolls.
Supplies: Toilet paper rolls, Paint, Glue, Googly eyes, Felt
Instructions: Paint and decorate toilet paper rolls with googly eyes and felt to create animal figures.

Description: Create a habitat using a shoebox.
Supplies: Shoebox, Paint, Glue, Small decorations, Plastic animals
Instructions: Decorate the inside of a shoebox to create a habitat and place plastic animals inside.

Description: A trip to Potter Park Zoo.
Supplies: Field trip shirt, Packed lunch, ID, Water bottle
Instructions: Ensure campers wear their field trip shirt, bring a packed lunch, water bottle, and board the bus at 12:00 PM.

Description: A cooking activity where campers will make bruschetta.
Instructions: Chop tomatoes, basil, and garlic. Mix them with olive oil and top on toasted bread.

Description: An experiment to create and observe moon craters.
Instructions: Fill a tray with flour, dust with cocoa powder, and drop balls from different heights to observe crater formation.

Description: A craft activity to create glowing jars inspired by the starry night.
Instructions: Paint the inside of jars with glow paint in a starry pattern and let dry.

Description: An activity to create edible models of planets.
Instructions: Use different fruits to represent planets and assemble them on toothpicks.

Description: A science activity to make a musical instrument using bananas.
Instructions: Connect bananas to the Makey Makey kit and a computer to play music by touching the bananas.

Description: A craft activity to make kites that look like fish.
Instructions: Decorate paper to look like fish, attach to sticks with string, and fly the kites outside.

Description: A craft activity to make wind chimes using seashells.
Instructions: Tie seashells to strings and attach them to a stick to create a wind chime.

Description: A craft activity to create sea creatures using paper mache.
Instructions: Mix flour and water to make paper mache paste, shape newspaper into sea creatures, let dry, and paint.

Description: A science activity to make silly putty using dish soap.
Instructions: Mix dish soap and cornstarch until it forms a putty-like consistency.

Description: A group game where participants play as different roles in a mafia-themed scenario.
Instructions: Assign roles to players (mafia, sheriff, doctor, civilians) and follow the game rules to eliminate the mafia or civilians.

Description: A series of cooperative and group games to encourage teamwork.
Instructions: Organize and play various cooperative games such as relay races, tug-of-war, or team-building activities.

Description: A variety of games focused on drama and acting.
Instructions: Engage in different drama games like charades, improvisation, and role-playing activities.

Description: A cooking activity to make salsa from scratch.
Instructions: Chop all ingredients, mix in a bowl, and season with lime and salt to taste.

Description: A craft activity to create jars that mimic the glow of lightning bugs.
Instructions: Paint the inside of jars with glow paint in a pattern to resemble lightning bugs and let dry.

Description: A craft activity to create various carnival games.
Instructions: Design and build different carnival games using cardboard and decorating supplies.

Description: A craft activity to make whirligigs.
Instructions: Decorate paper, cut into shapes, and attach to string to create spinning whirligigs.

Description: A scavenger hunt game where participants search for items based on clues.
Instructions: Provide a list of items and clues, and have participants search for them within a designated area.

Description: A science activity to create rockets using Alka Seltzer tablets.
Instructions: Fill film canisters with water, add Alka Seltzer, close the lid quickly, and watch them launch.

Description: A science activity to create a rainbow effect using M&Ms.
Instructions: Arrange M&Ms in a circle on a plate, pour water in the center, and observe the colors spread to form a rainbow.

Description: A carnival event with various games and face painting.
Instructions: Set up carnival game stations and offer face painting services to participants.

Description: A craft activity to create sand art and enjoy snow cones.
Instructions: Fill bottles with layers of colored sand to create art and make snow cones using the machine and syrup.

Description: A craft activity to create stained glass effect art using sidewalk chalk.
Instructions: Use tape to create patterns on the sidewalk and color in sections with chalk to create a stained glass effect.

Description: A craft activity to create art using bubbles and food coloring.
Instructions: Add food coloring to bubble solution, blow bubbles onto paper, and let the colors create patterns as they pop.

Description: A science experiment where kids will observe floating ink.
Instructions: Draw a shape on a glossy surface with the marker, pour water over it, and watch the ink float.

Description: A craft activity to create jellyfish suncatchers.
Instructions: Cut tissue paper into shapes, glue them onto the plate, attach string to the top, and hang the suncatcher.

Description: A science activity to make slime with a sea theme.
Instructions: Mix glue and food coloring, add baking soda, then add contact lens solution and mix until it forms slime.

Description: A cooking activity to create ocean-themed snack bars.
Instructions: Mix granola and honey, add food coloring, press into a pan, and decorate with fish candies.

Description: An outdoor activity involving various water games.
Instructions: Fill water balloons, set up buckets and sponges, and organize water-based relay races.

Description: A science experiment to create an eruption effect with 'moon dust'.
Instructions: Mix baking soda and food coloring, form into a mound, pour vinegar mixed with dish soap over it to create an eruption.

Description: An art activity to create homemade rockets.
Instructions: Decorate the paper towel rolls with construction paper and markers, add fins and a nose cone to complete the rocket.

Description: A science experiment to create invisible ink messages.
Instructions: Write a message with lemon juice using a cotton swab, let it dry, and reveal the message by heating the paper.

Description: A cooking activity where kids create adventure-themed snacks.
Instructions: Use cookie cutters to shape bread, spread peanut butter, and decorate with fruit slices.

Description: A physical activity involving a treasure hunt using GPS coordinates.
Instructions: Hide small treasures, provide GPS coordinates for the locations, and let kids use the devices to find them.

Description: A physical activity where kids solve puzzles to 'escape' a room.
Instructions: Set up a room with puzzles and locks, provide clues, and challenge kids to solve the puzzles to find the keys and escape.

Description: A cooking activity to create pizza with watermelon slices.
Instructions: Cut watermelon into round slices, spread yogurt on top, and decorate with fruit toppings to resemble pizza.

Description: A science activity where kids plan how to survive on the moon using limited resources.
Instructions: Provide a list of items and challenge kids to choose which items they would need to survive on the moon and explain why.

Description: Create a geyser by combining Mentos and soda.
Instructions: 1. Take a bottle of soda. 2. Drop Mentos into the soda. 3. Step back and watch the geyser form.

Description: Make optical illusions using paper.
Instructions: 1. Cut paper into desired shapes. 2. Draw patterns that create optical illusions. 3. Display the creations.

Description: Create your own kaleidoscope using household items.
Instructions: 1. Line the inside of a paper towel roll with Mylar sheets. 2. Secure one end with a clear plastic sheet and tape. 3. Add beads inside. 4. Secure the other end with another clear plastic sheet.

Description: Engage in water play activities.
Instructions: 1. Wear water shoes and a bathing suit. 2. Engage in various water play activities. 3. Dry off with a towel.

Description: Build creative structures using recycled materials.
Instructions: 1. Gather recycled materials. 2. Use safe tools to cut and shape materials. 3. Assemble the materials into creative structures.

Description: Visit Hawk Island Lake for outdoor activities.
Instructions: 1. Wear the field trip shirt. 2. Pack a disposable lunch and water bottle. 3. Apply sunscreen and bug spray. 4. Enjoy activities at Hawk Island Lake.

Description: Sample various foods from different cultures.
Instructions: 1. Collect foods from various cultures with ingredient lists. 2. Set up foods in a common area. 3. Allow kids and staff to sample the foods.

Description: Create a spinning motor using wires and magnets.
Instructions: 1. Shape the copper wire into a loop. 2. Attach magnets to the battery. 3. Place the wire loop over the battery and magnets, observing the spinning motion.

Description: Create fridge magnets featuring world flags.
Instructions: 1. Paint world flags on magnetic sheets. 2. Cut out the painted flags. 3. Use them as fridge magnets.

Description: Carve designs into bars of soap.
Instructions: 1. Choose a bar of soap. 2. Use carving tools to create designs. 3. Display the carved soap.

Description: Make travel passports for imaginative play.
Instructions: 1. Fold paper to resemble a passport. 2. Decorate with stickers and markers. 3. Use for imaginative travel play.

Description: Make corn kernels 'hop' in a jar using vinegar and baking soda.
Instructions: 1. Fill a jar with vinegar. 2. Add corn kernels. 3. Add baking soda and watch the kernels hop.

Description: Create a non-Newtonian fluid that dances to sound vibrations.
Instructions: 1. Mix cornstarch and water to make oobleck. 2. Place the mixture on a speaker. 3. Play music and watch the oobleck dance.

Description: Create a compass using a sewing needle.
Instructions: 1. Magnetize the needle by rubbing it with a magnet. 2. Insert the needle into a piece of cork. 3. Float the cork in a bowl of water and watch it point north.

Description: Show the effects of dry ice in various experiments.
Instructions: 1. Handle dry ice with gloves. 2. Place dry ice in warm water to create fog. 3. Add soap bubbles to the fog for a visual effect.

Description: Create a nature-themed mosaic or print using salt dough.
Instructions: 1. Gather nature items. 2. Press them into the salt dough to create imprints or mosaics. 3. Allow the dough to dry and harden.

Description: Design and create a nature-themed board game.
Instructions: 1. Design a board game layout on the board. 2. Decorate with nature-themed items. 3. Create rules and play the game.

Description: Craft a person using sticks and other natural materials.
Instructions: 1. Collect sticks and natural materials. 2. Assemble and glue the materials to form a stick person. 3. Allow to dry.

Description: Construct a boat using twigs and other natural materials.
Instructions: 1. Gather twigs and tie them together to form a boat shape. 2. Use leaves for the sail. 3. Test it in water.

Description: Create a loom using flowers and other natural materials.
Instructions: 1. Form a frame using small sticks. 2. Weave string to create a loom. 3. Insert flowers into the weave.

Description: Make snacks shaped like penguins.
Supplies: Ingredients for snacks (e.g., olives, cream cheese, carrots)
Instructions: 1. Use olives, cream cheese, and carrots to assemble snacks in the shape of penguins. 2. Serve and enjoy.

Description: Make a candle using crayons and other materials.
Instructions: 1. Melt crayons in a mold. 2. Insert a candle wick. 3. Allow to cool and harden.

Description: Carve shapes out of soap.
Instructions: 1. Use carving tools to sculpt shapes out of a soap bar. 2. Smooth and refine the carvings.

Description: Create a map using various materials.
Instructions: 1. Draw a map layout on paper. 2. Decorate with markers and other items. 3. Label and finish the map.

Description: Make a pen using a feather as the quill.
Instructions: 1. Cut the tip of the feather to form a nib. 2. Dip in ink and use as a pen.

Description: Construct a boat using a milk carton.
Instructions: 1. Cut the milk carton to form a boat shape. 2. Decorate with markers. 3. Test it in water.

Description: Create art inspired by ancient cave paintings.
Instructions: 1. Use charcoal and paint to create art on paper. 2. Mimic ancient cave painting styles.

Description: Make ice cream using bananas.
Instructions: 1. Freeze bananas. 2. Blend until smooth to create ice cream.

Description: Create art using foil to form relief designs.
Instructions: 1. Glue foil onto cardboard to form a design. 2. Press to create relief patterns.

Description: Build structures using recycled materials.
Instructions: 1. Gather recycled materials. 2. Design and build creative structures. 3. Display the finished work.

Description: Create tie-dye patterns on coffee filters.
Instructions: 1. Color coffee filters with markers. 2. Spray with water to create tie-dye effect. 3. Allow to dry.

Description: Make rice cakes decorated to look like owls.
Instructions: 1. Use fruits and nuts to decorate rice cakes. 2. Arrange to resemble owls.

Description: Create masks using leaves and other natural materials.
Instructions: 1. Collect leaves. 2. Glue onto paper to form mask shapes. 3. Cut out and wear.

Description: Make parachutes using simple materials.
Instructions: 1. Cut plastic bags into parachute shapes. 2. Attach strings and small objects. 3. Drop to test.

Description: Build a car powered by rubber bands.
Instructions: 1. Construct a car frame using cardboard. 2. Attach wheels and rubber bands. 3. Wind the rubber bands to power the car.

Description: Create silly putty using dish soap.
Instructions: 1. Mix dish soap and cornstarch to form putty. 2. Knead until desired consistency is reached.

Description: Make stained glass art using tissue paper.
Instructions: 1. Cut tissue paper into shapes. 2. Glue onto wax paper to form stained glass designs. 3. Allow to dry.

Description: Create a tree sculpture using paper.
Instructions: 1. Cut paper into tree shapes. 2. Assemble and glue to form a 3D tree sculpture.

Activity Title: Capture the Flag at Sanders Preserve Trails
Description: Play a game of capture the flag at Sanders Preserve Trails.
Instructions: 1. Divide into teams. 2. Set up flags and boundaries. 3. Play capture the flag.

Description: Trip to Patriarche Park for outdoor activities.
Instructions: 1. Travel to Patriarche Park. 2. Engage in various outdoor activities.

Description: Visit to Frederik Meijer Garden in Grand Rapids.
Instructions: 1. Travel to Frederik Meijer Garden. 2. Explore the gardens and exhibits.

Description: Field trip to Potter Park Zoo.
Instructions: 1. Travel to Potter Park Zoo. 2. Explore the zoo and animal exhibits.

Description: Trip to Lake Lansing for swimming.
Instructions: 1. Travel to Lake Lansing. 2. Swim and enjoy water activities.
